contentrichtext.text: '''Ivo Papazov''' ({{lang-bg|Иво Папазов}}) (born 16 February 1952 in [[Kardzhali]]), nicknamed '''Ibryama''' ({{lang|bg|Ибряма}}), is a [[Bulgaria]]n [[clarinet]]ist. He leads the "Ivo Papazov Wedding Band" in performances of [[jazz]]-infused [[Stambolovo music]], and is one of the premier creators of the genre known as "wedding band" music in Bulgaria, along with the violinist Georgi Yanev, saxophonist Yuri Yunakov and accordionists Neshko Neshev, Ivan Milev and Peter Ralchev. Together with [[Emilia (Bulgarian singer)|Emilia]] they are known as Mames 2001. An orchestra that had great success in the TV show Познай кой е под масатаn (Guess who is under the table). According to [http://www.garthcartwright.com/7Biography.htm Garth Cartwright], he was "the first Balkan Gypsy musician to win a wide international following with his two Joe Boyd-produced albums for [[Hannibal Records]] in the early 1990s."<ref>{{cite web | last = Cartwright | first = Garth | authorlink = | coauthors = | title = Review: ''Dance of the Falcon'' | work = | publisher = [[fRoots]] | date = August 2008 | url = http://www.frootsmag.com/content/issue/reviews/ | format = | doi = | accessdate = 2008-08-13}} Archived by [[Webcitation.org|WebCite]] at [http://www.webcitation.org/5a1eRwF85 http://www.webcitation.org/5a1eRwF85].</ref> Papasov and his Wedding Band have toured the United States several times. In 2005 Papasov won the Audience Award from the [[BBC]]'s Radio3 World Music Awards.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/radio3/world/awards2005/audienceaward.shtml|newspaper=BBC - Radio 3 |title=Awards for World Music 2005: Ivo Papazov (Bulgaria)}}</ref> Papasov and Yuri Yunakov are briefly profiled and the recording of "Kurdzhaliiska Ruchenica" from their 2005 album ''Together Again'' is analyzed in the popular textbook, ''Worlds of Music'', 5th Edition.<ref>{{cite book|last=Cooley|first=Timothy|year=2009|publisher=Schirmer Cengage Learning|location=Belmont, Cal.|isbn=978-0-534-59539-5|title=Custom Enrichment Module: Worlds of Music: An Introduction to the Music of the World's Peoples|pages=256-259}}</ref>. Ivo Papasov was born to a [[Romani people|Gypsy]] family <ref>{{Cite web|url=http://ivo_papasov.mondomix.com/en/artiste.htm|date=30 March 2003|publisher=Mondomix: Le magazine des musiques et cultures dans le monde |title=Ivo Papazov|archiveurl=http://web.archive.org/web/20070507002224/http://ivo_papasov.mondomix.com/en/artiste.htm|archivedate=7 May 2007|deadurl=yes}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|title=Ivo Papazov|publisher=Mondomix: Le magazine des musiques et cultures dans le monde|url=http://www.mondomix.com/e/ivo_papasov}}</ref> in Bulgaria and his original name is Ibrahim (Turkish name). As a result of the extensive programme of forced nationalisation of ethnic minority groups during Bulgaria's socialist rule, Papazov changed his first name to Ivo (adapted from Ibo, short for Ibrahim). He speaks Turkish and comes from [[Kardzhali]], a city close to Bulgaria’s Turkish and Greek borders.
